intro: Rinorea laxiflora, commonly known as the silky leaf rinorea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, Colombia, and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its soft, velvety leaves that give it its common name. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in terminal inflorescences. Rinorea laxiflora is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and relatively low maintenance requirements.
